main event: A letter from an optometrist in Dickson, Tennessee, dated 26 October 1949, reported sighting a flying saucer on a farm seven miles from town, describing it as saucer-shaped, made of aluminum, flying at a very high rate of speed, and powered by motors. The witness mentioned that it is invisible unless struck by the sun at the proper angle.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by an optometrist from Dickson, Tennessee, adding credibility to the witness.
The flying saucer was described as being very high and of huge size.
The object was reported to be made of aluminum and powered by motors, not jets.
The witness indicated that there were four other adults who saw the object as well, supporting the credibility of the sighting.
The witness expressed a preference for no publicity on the matter, suggesting potential concerns about public attention.
